title: Science + Visual — Photosynthesis with ADHD
description: Science lesson plan on photosynthesis for Grade 7, adapted for students with ADHD. NGSS-aligned, English.
prompt: Create a science lesson plan about photosynthesis for 7th grade. The class has students with ADHD.
subject: Science

objectives.text: Construct a scientific explanation based on evidence for the role of photosynthesis in the cycling of matter and flow of energy into and out of organisms.
Develop a model to describe how food is rearranged through chemical reactions forming new molecules that support growth and/or release energy.

steps.title: Hook — The Mystery Plant
instructions: Show a 60-second time-lapse video of a plant growing toward sunlight.
Ask: 'Why does the plant move? Where does it get energy?'
Quick 2-minute Think-Pair-Share.
activities: Time-lapse video + Think-Pair-Share with movement (stand up to find partner).
assessment: Students name at least 1 input plants need to grow.

steps.title: Visual Model Building
instructions: Distribute color-coded diagram cards: sunlight (yellow), water (blue), CO2 (gray), glucose (green), O2 (red).
Students physically arrange cards to model the photosynthesis equation.
Timer visible on screen: 5 min to build, 2 min to check with neighbor.
activities: Hands-on card sorting to build photosynthesis equation.
assessment: Model shows correct inputs (sunlight, water, CO2) and outputs (glucose, O2).

steps.title: Movement Break + Quick Lab
instructions: 1-minute stretch break.
Simple leaf observation: students hold a leaf up to light and sketch what they see.
Guided question: 'Where in the leaf does photosynthesis happen?'
activities: Leaf observation and quick sketch (3 min max).
assessment: Students identify that photosynthesis happens in green parts (chloroplasts).

steps.title: Wrap-Up — Exit Ticket
instructions: Display the photosynthesis equation on screen.
Students complete a 3-question exit ticket (multiple choice + 1 short answer).
Option to answer verbally to teacher.
activities: Exit ticket with visual equation reference.
assessment: Score at least 2/3 on exit ticket.
Short answer names one product of photosynthesis.

summary: Today we'll discover how plants make their own food using sunlight!
You'll watch a video, build a model, observe a real leaf, and show what you learned.

steps.title: Watch
instructions: Watch the plant video.
Stand up and find a partner to share your idea.
check_for_understanding: What does the plant need to grow?

steps.title: Build
instructions: Use the colored cards to build the photosynthesis equation.
Check with a neighbor when the timer rings.
check_for_understanding: Which cards are inputs? Which are outputs?
self_regulation_prompts: It's OK to stand while working.
Use the timer to stay on track.

steps.title: Observe
instructions: Stretch first!
Hold the leaf up to the light and sketch what you see.
check_for_understanding: Where does the green color come from?
self_regulation_prompts: Take a deep breath if you feel restless.

steps.title: Show
instructions: Complete the exit ticket.
You can tell the teacher your answer instead of writing.
check_for_understanding: What are the products of photosynthesis?

glossary: Photosynthesis: the process plants use to make food from sunlight
Chloroplast: the part of the plant cell where photosynthesis happens
Glucose: a sugar that plants make as food
Carbon dioxide (CO2): a gas plants absorb from the air
alternative_response_options: You can answer verbally instead of writing.
Drawing is accepted for the observation task.

strategies: Visible timer on screen for each activity
Option for verbal responses to reduce writing load
do_not: Do not require sustained silent reading > 5 minutes
Do not have passive listening > 7 minutes
Do not penalize fidgeting or standing
notes: Seat near front or away from distractions

media_requirements: Time-lapse plant growth video (60 seconds, MP4)
Fresh leaves for observation (1 per student)
ui_recommendations: Bold section headers with clear progress indicator
visual_schedule_notes: 4 segments with icons: Watch, Build, Observe, Show
teacher_review_points: Test video playback on classroom equipment
